intro: Cullen candidum, commonly known as the white cullen, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets, and it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. Cullen candidum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along riverbanks.
